title: Circuits constitute district for criminal trial by jury
context: ยง806-17 Circuits constitute district for criminal trial by jury. The judicial circuits of the State established by section 603-1 are deemed to be the &ldquo;districts&rdquo; referred to in Article I, section 14, of the Constitution of the State with respect to the right to a trial by jury in criminal prosecutions, until such time as the legislature of the State shall otherwise provide. [L 1959, c 125, ยง2; HRS ยง711-17; ren L 1972, c 9, pt of ยง1] Rules of Court Venue, see HRPP rule 18.
